elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Answer the following knowledge questions.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: a) Why is Switzerland described as a special democratic case?
elements.correctAnswer: Compared to other democracies, the Swiss people have far more opportunities for direct co-determination.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: b) What is the purpose of the separation of powers?
elements.correctAnswer: Limiting the power of the authorities and mutual control

elements.name: question3
elements.title: c) Who represents the judiciary at federal level in Switzerland?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: d) Which authority is the executive power in Switzerland at federal level?

elements.name: question5
elements.title: e) Who elects the legislative authority in Switzerland?

elements.name: question6
elements.title: f) Which two chambers make up the federal parliament, the legislature?
elements.correctAnswer: from the National Council and the Council of States

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following knowledge questions.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: g) What is meant by a militia parliament?
elements.correctAnswer: The members of parliament perform their work on a part-time basis.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: h) What is the difference in terms of the composition of parliamentary groups and committees?
elements.correctAnswer: Political groups consist of members of the same party, and various parties are represented in committees.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: i) How are the 200 seats in the National Council allocated?
elements.correctAnswer: according to the population of the cantons

elements.name: question10
elements.title: j) How many seats in the Council of States does a full canton and how many does a half-canton benefit from?
elements.correctAnswer: Whole canton two, half canton one

elements.name: question11
elements.title: k) Why is the Federal Council referred to as a concordance government?
elements.correctAnswer: The most important parties are represented and share responsibility for the government.

elements.name: question12
elements.title: l) What is meant by the principle of collegiality?
elements.correctAnswer: The Federal Council always decides jointly and represents its decisions as a unified opinion.

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following knowledge questions.

elements.name: question13
elements.title: m) Which Latin term is used to express the fact that the President of the Swiss Confederation has no more power than the other members of the government?

elements.name: question14
elements.title: n) What is the main task of the Federal Chancellor?
elements.correctAnswer: the administrative management of the Federal Chancellery, i.e. the staff unit of the Federal Council

elements.name: question15
elements.title: o) What does the Department of Home Affairs deal with? Name three areas.

elements.name: question16
elements.title: p) By whom and for how long are the federal judges elected?
elements.correctAnswer: by the United Federal Assembly (NR and SR) for six years

elements.name: question17
elements.title: q) In which year was Switzerland's first federal constitution drawn up?

elements.name: question18
elements.title: r) What consequences does Swiss neutrality have for the Swiss Armed Forces?
elements.correctAnswer: It must not take part in the wars of other states.
